definition: sect/school (group of followers of a particular doctrine)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: Well, you mentioned Kungfu, or boxing just now, I would say there are about 200 schools.
sentences.chinese: 你提到了功夫，或拳术，它们至少有200种门派。

sentences.english: Master Wang is the leader of the Hong Men, a group which is noted for its kungfu skills.
sentences.chinese: 王进发师傅是洪门的山主，该门派以其功夫技巧闻名。

sentences.english: This is the devil incarnate gathers the gate faction which under 43,000 monsters audiences establishes.
sentences.chinese: 此乃混世魔王聚集手下四万三千妖众成立的门派。

sentences.english: Door-to-door discrimination, in fact, if clearance can blame Round 2, 2 long enough.
sentences.chinese: 门派歧视，其实只要2回合能清怪，2龙足够了。

sentences.english: Each kungfu familiy have people who are for and against competitions.
sentences.chinese: 每个功夫门派都有支持或反对武术比赛的人。

sentences.english: This seems to mean that Tai Chi Chuan is an absolutely independent martial arts.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎说明了太极拳绝对可以称之为独立的武术门派。

definition: the Shaolin monastery and martial arts school
